1.label: On Off Status After Power Failure

20.label: Switch / Input Type for IN1
20.description: Switch / Input Type for IN1. Choose the input/switch type you want to connect to the IN1 terminal. Default: momentary switch

options.label: toggle switch (on when swithc is on)

21.label: Switch / Input Type for IN2
21.description: Switch / Input Type for IN2. Choose the input/switch type you want to connect to the IN2 terminal. Default: momentary switch

options.label: toggle switch (on when swithc is on)

22.label: Switch / Input Type for IN3
22.description: Switch / Input Type for IN3. Choose the input/switch type you want to connect to the IN3 terminal. Default: momentary switch

options.label: toggle switch (on when swithc is on)

23.label: Switch / Input Type for IN4
23.description: Switch / Input Type for IN4. Choose the input/switch type you want to connect to the IN4 terminal. Default: momentary switch

options.label: toggle switch (on when swithc is on)

62.label: Power Report Frequency
62.description: Power Report Frequency. Choose how often you want your RGBW Dimmer to report power consumption (W) to your controller. NOTE: must be 0, or an increment of 30. Default: 3600

65.label: Energy Report Threshold
65.description: Energy Report Threshold. Choose how you want your RGBW Dimmer to report energy use (kWh) to your hub. The number entered as value corresponds to decimal values in energy useage change. So if 10 is entered by default, the RGBW Dimmer will report any change in energy use over 0.1 kWh. Energy reports are sent in t least 30-second intervals.

66.label: Energy Report Frequency
66.description: Energy Report Frequency. Choose how often you want your RGBW Dimmer to report energy (kWh) to your controller. NOTE: must be 0, or an increment of 30. Default: 3600

150.label: RGBW/HSB Wall Switch Mode
150.description: RGBW/HSB Wall Switch Mode. Choose how switches connected to the input terminals control your LED strip. In the default RGBW mode, each switch connected to each input terminal controls the RGBW chnnels separately (so IN1 for red, IN2 for green, etc.) with a single click for ON/OFF, double click to full brightness, and press-and-hold to dim (momentary switches only). In the HSB, IN1 controls hue, IN2 - saturation, IN3 - brightness, IN4 - white with single click for last set value or value 0, double click to max value, and press-and-hold to set custom value. Default: RGBW mode

151.label: Ramp Rate (switch)
151.description: Ramp Rate (switch). Adjust the ramp rate for your RGBW dimmer (fade-in/fade-out effect for on/off operation). Values correspond to the number of seconds it takes for the dimmer to reach full brightness or turn off when operated from the connected wall switch. Note that 0 is instant on/off. Default : 3 seconds

152.label: Ramp Rate (Z-Wave)
152.description: Ramp Rate (Z-Wave). Adjust the ramp rate for your RGBW dimmer (fade-in/fade-out effect for on/off operation). Values correspond to the number of seconds it takes for the dimmer to reach full brightness or turn off when operated remotely from the Z-Wave hub Note that 0 is instant on/off. Default : 3 seconds

157.label: Preset Programs
157.description: Enable one of the preset animated color programs to set the mood with a click. Default: preset programs disabled
